columns_data: The component shall be developed according to ASIL B(D).

Safety Requirement - See Attribute 'Object Text_DXL'

For 011_Object State -> 011_DXL_Object State
For 013_Functional Safety Category -> 013_DXL_Functional Safety Category
For 881_Safety Goal -> 881_DXL_Safety Goal
The component shall prioritize user initiated functions over automatically initiated functions.

The component shall not impair service brake functions. This includes the slip- control abilities to retard the vehicle, maintain stability or assist the driver to follow the intended path.

Note: 
The component must not request hydraulic deceleration and electromechanical deceleration in parallel.
Avoid hydraulic- and electromechanical control functions will impair eachother.
The component shall be able to enable and disable automatic functions via vehicle configuration (Anpasskanal).

The component shall not inhibit any actuation request on the interface SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest due to the received actuator status via the interfaces SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft or SsmPbInActuatorStateRight. 

Note:
No component may degrade the other component.

In case of several concurrent valid apply/release demands the component shall perform the latest valid apply/release demand in accordance to the functional arbitration (refer to EPBi-Core-SyDesign_3660).
If there is no functional degradation of the hydraulic actuator, a dynamic braking request by the park brake control must be executed via the hydraulic actuator.

The component shall receive and process signals from other system components according SSM_PB-CT (input signals).
Reference to: 025 System Component Interfaces/SSM_PB-CT

The component shall provide signals to other system components according SSM_PB-CT (output signals).
Reference to: 025 System Component Interfaces/SSM_PB-CT
The component shall provide the signal SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest for at least two calculation cycles of the PBC.

Safety Requirement - See Attribute 'Object Text_DXL'

For 011_Object State -> 011_DXL_Object State
For 013_Functional Safety Category -> 013_DXL_Functional Safety Category
For 881_Safety Goal -> 881_DXL_Safety Goal

The component shall read in necessary variant information to provide variant management for the SSM_PB.

Note: All necessary variant items are defined in the SSM_PB-CT module.

The component shall read and evaluate parameter file to provide parameter information SSM_PB internally in each ignitinon cycle.

<<Customer dependent>>
The component shall ensure that all functional requests are provided for arbitration and that the arbitration is performed in the following defined order.
The component shall ensure that all functional requests are provided for arbitration and that the arbitration is performed in the defined order.

The component shall provide the switch demanded functional requests (demanded via SsmPbInSwitchState) as long as requested from the concerning function via SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest / SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest.
The component shall determine statistic data counters based on the defined events as long as the counter value is in the specified range.

263 - SsmPbOutDataStorageWrite[SSM_PB_MAX_NUMBER_EEDATA]:

The component shall provide data for storage at SsmPbOutDataStorageWrite[SSM_PB_MAX_NUMBER_EEDATA].
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[6...9] as 'SwitchApplyCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[10...13] as 'SwitchReleaseCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[14...17] as 'AutomaticApplyCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[18...21] as 'AutomaticReleaseCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[22...23] as 'ExternalApplyCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[24...25] as 'ExternalReleaseCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[26...27] as 'RollerBenchApplyCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[28...29] as 'DynDecelByHydraulicCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[30...31] as 'DynDecelByEPBCounter'.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutStoredDataWrite[32...35] as 'OperatingTimeCounter'.
The component shall determine the signal SsmPbOutPowertrainProtection as 'NotActive' as default.

265 - SsmPbOutPowertrainProtection.Active:

IF
	SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = 'ParkApplied'
AND
	SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = 'ParkApplied'
AND
 	'DriverControlsTheVehicle' = True
AND
	(
		NOT 'DaaPossible' = True
	OR
		'EcdPowertrainProtectionPostConditions' = True
	OR
		SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
	)
AND
	above conditions are continuously present for 120 ms,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutPowertrainProtection as Active.

266 - SsmPbOutEcuPowerLatchRequest.True:

IF
	'PadWearAdjustmentObservation' = Active 
OR
	'IgnitionOffApplyObservation' = Active 
OR
 	'SwitchFailureApplyObservation' = Active 
OR 
	'EngineStallApplyObservation' = Active 
OR 
	Customer specific conditions for PowerLatch,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutEcuPowerLatchRequest as Requested.

266 - SsmPbOutEcuPowerLatchRequest.True:

IF
	'PadWearAdjustmentObservation' = Active 
OR
           'Ecd' = Active 
OR 
	Customer specific conditions for PowerLatch

OR

 	 transition of SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest from None to any other value was detected in the last 5 sec 
  	AND actuation was not yet started caused by this transition (no Actuator State changed to applying or releasing)

	

the component shall determine SsmPbOutEcuPowerLatchRequest as Requested.

266 - SsmPbOutEcuCommunicationLatchRequest.True:

IF
	'PadWearAdjustmentObservation' = Active 
OR
	'IgnitionOffApplyObservation' = Active 
OR
 	'SwitchFailureApplyObservation' = Active 
OR 
	'EngineStallApplyObservation' = Active 
OR 
	Customer specific conditions for CommunicationLatch,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutEcuCommunicationLatchRequest as Requested.

266 - SsmPbOutEcuCommunicationLatchRequest.True:

IF
	'PadWearAdjustmentObservation' = Active 
OR

	'Ecd' = Active 

the component shall determine SsmPbOutEcuCommunicationLatchRequest as Requested.
The component shall determine SsmPbOutParameterPlausibilityCheck as 'NoResult' as long as no check has been performed.
The safety mechanism shall achieve or maintain the safe state within t <= 'FTTI_SG'.

268 - SsmPbInStoredDataRead[SSM_PB_MAX_NUMBER_EEDATA]:

During initialization phase, the component shall read data of SsmPbInStoredDataRead[SSM_PB_MAX_NUMBER_EEDATA].

TF201 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND 
	'RefSpeedSsmPb' <= V_VEHICLE_STATIC_THRESHOLD
AND
	SsmPbInSdApplyPSSD = Normal,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

TF201 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND 
	'VehicleStateSsmPb' = Static
AND
	SsmPbInSdApplyPSSD = Normal

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

TF201 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	NOT SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply,

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest is not determined as 'ParkApply'.

Note:
This requirement is only valid for TF201. All other TFs are not affected.

TF202 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
		'SsmPbVariantItem0' = Enabled
	AND
		'DriverIntentionToParkX2P' = True
	AND
		'RefSpeedSsmPb' <= V_VEHICLE_STATIC_THRESHOLD
	AND
		SsmPbInX2PPSSD = Normal
	AND
		NOT 'AutomaticApplyInhibit' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest is not determined as 'ParkApply'.

Note:
This requirement is only valid for TF202. All other TFs are not affected.

TF207 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	'SsmPbVariantItem0' = Enabled
AND
	'DriverIntentionToParkESA' = True
AND
	'RefSpeedSsmPb' <= V_VEHICLE_STATIC_THRESHOLD
AND
	SsmPbInEngineStallApplyPSSD = Normal
AND
	NOT 'AutomaticApplyInhibit' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

TF207 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	'SsmPbVariantItem0' = Enabled
AND
	'DriverIntentionToParkESA' = True
AND
	'VehicleStateSsmPb' = Static
AND
	SsmPbInEngineStallApplyPSSD = Normal
AND
	NOT 'AutomaticApplyInhibit' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

TF211 - SsmPbOutDriveAwayIntentionIndication.True:

IF
	SsmPbInAcceleratorPedalPosition > ACCELERATOR_PEDAL_POSITION_DAA_MIN 
AND
	SsmPbInGear != Park or Neutral or Invalid
AND
		SsmPbInEngineStatus = 'EngineRunning'
	
	OR
		SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active
		AND
		SsmPbInEngineStatus = 'EngineInvalid',

the component shall determine SsmPbOutDriveAwayIntentionIndication as Indicated.

Note: 
SsmPbOutDriveAwayIntentionIndication provides the information for PBC that the driver controls the vehicle and a RollAwayReclamp is not necessary.

TF211 - SsmPbOutDaaConditionsFulfilled.Fulfilled:

AND
	'VehicleIsReadyToDrive' = True
AND
	'DriverPresent' = Present,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutDaaConditionsFulfilled as Fulfilled.

TF211 - SsmPbOutDaaConditionsFulfilled.NotFulfilled:

IF
	NOT 'DriverControlsTheVehicle' = True
OR
	NOT 'VehicleIsReadyToDrive' = True
OR

the component shall determine SsmPbOutDaaConditionsFulfilled as 'NotFulfilled'.

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest is not determined as Release.

	'DriverPresent' condition is fulfilled before the 'DriverControlsTheVehicle' and 'VehicleThrustPreventsRollback' conditions are fulfilled,

the component shall request actuation.

ELSE

IF
DriveAwayIntention=TRUE
AND
{
SeatbeltStatus==SsmPbSeatBeltStatus_t.eSsmPbSeatBeltOpen
OR
brakelightswitch==SsmPbBrakeLightSwitch_t.eSsmPbBrakeLightSwitchOn
}
Then SsmPbOut.DaaTextMessageRequired=eSsmPbDaaTextMessageRequired;

Note:
Request actuation as described in EPBi-Core-SyDesign_6379.

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest.Requested:

IF
	'HydraulicDecelerationNecessary' = True
AND
	SsmPbInEcdPSSD = Normal,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest as Requested
AND
SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue as 5m/s2.

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest.Requested:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND	
	'RefSpeedSsmPb' > V_VEHICLE_STATIC_THRESHOLD
AND	
	'EcdPossible' = True
AND	
	NOT 'DecelerationCancelled' = True
AND
	NOT 'RollerbenchDetected' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest as Requested
AND
SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue as 'SsmPbVariantItem25' .

Safety Requirement - See Attribute 'Object Text_DXL'

For 011_Object State -> 011_DXL_Object State
For 013_Functional Safety Category -> 013_DXL_Functional Safety Category
For 881_Safety Goal -> 881_DXL_Safety Goal

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest.Requested:

IF
	NOT SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply,

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest is not determined as Requested and SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue is not determined as 0.

Note:
This requirement is only valid for TF220. All other TFs are not affected.

Safety Requirement - See Attribute 'Object Text_DXL'

For 011_Object State -> 011_DXL_Object State
For 013_Functional Safety Category -> 013_DXL_Functional Safety Category
For 881_Safety Goal -> 881_DXL_Safety Goal

The component shall increase the requested deceleration value SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue from zero to target deceleration value with a ramp.

Note: Customer specific thresholds shall be considered.

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest.NotRequested:

IF
	'HydraulicDecelerationCancelled' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest as 'NotRequested'
AND
SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue as 0 m/s².

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue:

IF
 	(
 		SsmPbInSwitchState = Neutral
 	AND 
 		'VehicleStateSsmPb' = Dynamic
 	)
OR
	(
	SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = 'ParkApplied’
	AND
	SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = 'ParkApplied’
	),

the component shall ramp down SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue until 0 m/s²
AND
afterwards determine SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationRequest as 'NotRequested'.

TF220 - SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationMonitor:

IF
	'EcdDecelerationMonitoringActive' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationMonitor as Fulfilled.

TF220 - Target Deceleration:

IF
 	'HydraulicDecelerationNecessary' = True 
AND
 	(
 		SsmPbInHydraulicDecelerationFallback = Normal
 	OR
 		SsmPbInHydraulicDecelerationFallback = Invalid
	),

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue is determined as 5m/s2after ramp up.

TF220 - Target Deceleration Fallback:

IF
	'HydraulicDecelerationNecessary' = True 
AND
	SsmPbInHydraulicDecelerationFallback = Fallback,

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutHydraulicDecelerationValue is determined as 5m/s2 after ramp up.

TF221 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.DynamicApply:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND	
	'EcdFallbackConditionsActive' = True
AND	
	NOT 'DecelerationCancelled' = True
AND	
	NOT 'HydraulicDecelerationActive' = Active
AND	
	(
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Released
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Released
	OR
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Released
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Unknown
	OR
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Unknown
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Released
	)
AND	
	(
		SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active		
		AND
		'RefSpeedSsmPb' > V_VEHICLE_STATIC_THRESHOLD
	OR
		NOT SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active
		AND
		'RefSpeedSsmPb' >= V_MAX_SAFETY_STATIC_SPEED
	)
AND
	SsmPbInRwuPSSD = Normal,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'DynamicApply' as long as switch is in apply position.

TF221 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.DynamicApply:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND	
	'EcdFallbackConditionsActive' = True
AND	
	NOT 'DecelerationCancelled' = True
AND	
	NOT 'HydraulicDecelerationActive' = Active
AND	
	(
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Released
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Released
	OR
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Released
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Unknown
	OR
		SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = Unknown
		AND
		SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = Released
	)
AND	
	(
		SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active		
		AND
		'VehicleStateSsmPb' = Dynamic
	OR
		NOT SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active
		AND
		'RefSpeedSsmPb' >= V_MAX_SAFETY_STATIC_SPEED
	)
AND
	SsmPbInRwuPSSD = Normal,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'DynamicApply' as long as the switch is in apply position.

TF221 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.ParkApply:

IF
	SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
AND	
	'EcdFallbackConditionsActive' = True
AND	
	NOT 'DecelerationCancelled' = True
AND
	NOT SsmPbInDriveCycleStatus = Active
AND
	'RefSpeedSsmPb' < V_MAX_SAFETY_STATIC_SPEED,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'ParkApply'.

TF221 - NOT SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.DynamicApply:

IF
	NOT SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply,

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest is not determined as 'DynamicApply'.

Note:
This requirement is only valid for TF221. All other TFs are not affected.

TF230 - SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest.RollerbenchApply:

IF
		SsmPbInSwitchState = Apply
	AND
		'RollerbenchDetected' = True
	AND	
			NOT SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = 'ParkApplied'
		OR
			NOT SsmPbInActuatorStateLeft = 'HoldApplied'
	AND	
			NOT SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = 'ParkApplied'
		OR
			NOT SsmPbInActuatorStateRight = 'HoldApplied'
	AND	
		SsmPbInHuConditionsPSSD = Normal (Rollerbench Apply PSSD)
	

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as 'RollerbenchApply'.

Note:

OR	
	SsmPbInSwitchState = 'FaultApply'
OR	
	SsmPbInSwitchState = 'FaultRelease',

the component shall determine SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest as Release.

OR

the component shall ensure that SsmPbOutApplyReleaseRequest is not determined as 'RollerbenchApply'.

2004 - SsmPbOutRollerbenchDetected.Detected:

IF
	'RollerbenchDetected' = True,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutRollerBenchDetected as Detected.

2004 - SsmPbOutRollerbenchDetected.NotDetected:

IF
	'RollerbenchDetected' = False,

the component shall determine SsmPbOutRollerBenchDetected as 'NotDetected'.

2004 - SsmPbOutRollerbenchDetected.Detected:

IF
	One or more wheel speeds become invalid for longer than
	TIME_EXIT_HU_MODE
OR
	One or more Front wheel speeds become greater than
	V_EXIT_HU_MODE for longer than TIME_EXIT_HU_MODE
OR
	(
	One or more Rear wheel speeds not in range of
		V_DETECT_ROLLERBENCH_SPEED_MIN
		to
		V_DETECT_ROLLERBENCH_SPEED_MAX

Approval of park brake actuation for the specific direction shall be given via an additional instance in the HOST (host safety barrier).
Approval of park brake actuation shall be switched via the host safety barrier in accordance with table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in apply direction via the host safety barrier for 30 s after the actuation request changes to HsbInApplyReleaseRequest = ParkApply/HoldApply/PadAdjustment/DynamicApply.

Note: Refer to 'ApplyTimer'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release direction via the host safety barrier for 5 s after the actuation request changes to HsbInApplyReleaseRequest = Release.

Note: Refer to 'ReleaseTimer'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release direction via the host safety barrier for 35 s after the actuation request changes to HsbInApplyReleaseRequest = 'PadAdjustment'.

Note: Refer to 'ReleaseTimer'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release and apply direction via the host safety barrier during an actuation request HsbInApplyReleaseRequest =
'DynamicApply'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release direction via the host safety barrier for 35 s, if the actuation request HsbInApplyReleaseRequest changes from 'DynamicApply' to None OR HsbInRollerbenchActive changes to Inactive. (VehicleOperationalMode leaves 'HU-Mode')

Note: Refer to 'ReleaseTimer'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release and apply direction via the host safety barrier during an active factory diagnostic session.

Note: Refer to 'ApplyTimer' and 'ReleaseTimer'.

In addition to the table Definition of the Host Safety Barrier States, approval of park brake actuation shall be switched in release and apply direction via the host safety barrier for 35 s after the diagnostic actuation request HsbInDiagRequest.

Note: Refer to 'ApplyTimer' and 'ReleaseTimer'.
